title: 115_hr1574
content: The "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" is a bill that aims to provide viewpoint protection in communications. It amends Title I of the Communications Act of 1934 to include provisions for protecting viewpoints. The bill "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" prohibits the Federal Communications Commission from taking action against individuals based on their viewpoints on public issues in broadcast content. It also prohibits placing conditions on viewpoints in transaction reviews. This does not affect the Commission's authority to act on violations of specific laws. The "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" prohibits the FCC from taking action against individuals based on their viewpoints in broadcast content. It also prohibits placing conditions on viewpoints in transaction reviews. This includes violations of specific laws and public interest obligations. The "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" prohibits the President from directing agencies to take action against individuals based on their viewpoints in broadcast content or placing conditions on viewpoints in transaction reviews. The "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" prohibits the President from directing agencies to take action based on violations of specific sections of the United States Code in broadcast content. The "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" prohibits the President from directing agencies to take action based on incitement in broadcast content. The term "agency" is defined in section 551 of title 5, United States Code.
